page.title: 03Whickham
page.content: South of the B63l7 are three lanes, two leading to Sunniside, the third to Burnopfield. Along and between these Whickham's residential area can be found. It is an interesting mixture of stone houses and small terraces built before the end of the l9th. century, mixed in with very large houses built up to World War II. New luxury homes have appeared lately on 'infill' sites. Apart from a number of former colliery houses, now privately owned, and a small council estate with a few surviving 'prefabs', the bulk of the post war housing is on new private estates, built to satisfy a desire for good quality suburban housing. The estates are spacious and retain many mature trees. The semi-rural atmosphere and excellent facilities make it a desirable place to live.
